info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF 646 - Appointment

### Release : Pre-release 18.0 - April 2018

Appointment API is one of Pre-Ordering Management API Family. An Appointment is an arrangement to do something or meet someone at a particular time and place. It is previously made during an interaction or may be necessary to solve a customer problem or to deliver a product order item. The appointment API goal is to manage an appointment with all the necessary characteristics. First, the API consists in searching free time slots based on given parameters. Then, the appointment is created. The appointment has characteristics such as nature of appointment, place of appointment…

### Resources
- Appointment
- SearchTimeSlot
- Hub

### Operations
Appointment API performs the following operations :
- Retrieve available time slots depending on filter criteria before creating or rescheduling an appointment
- Retrieve an existing appointment or a collection of appointments
- Create an appointment
- Update an appointment to cancel or reschedule it for example
- Delete an appointment
- Notify events on appointment

Copyright © TM Forum 2018. All Rights Reserved

post.description:
This operation is used to create an appointment.
The specifications document provides  the  list  of  mandatory  and  non-mandatory  attributes  when  creating  an 
appointment, including any possible rule conditions and applicable default values.

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in

patch.description:
This operation allows partial updates of an appointment entity. Support of json/merge (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7386) is mandatory, support of json/patch (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5789) is optional. It also can be used to cancel an appointment by modifying its state. The new state is ‘cancelled’.
The specifications document provides the list of patchable and not patchable attributes, including constraint rules on 
their usage.

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in

HTTP Response 422 Unprocessable entity

get.description:
This operation list search time slots entities.
Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.
Filtering may be available depending on the compliance level supported by an implementation.
Note: A specific implementation of the Appointment Management API can choose whether or not to implement GET, PATCH, and DELETE for the SearchTimeSlot task resource, according to business considerations (such as the need for accounting or the need to support asynchronous search).

Specific business errors for current operation will be encapsulated in

HTTP Response 422 Unprocessable entity

reason.description: Text that explains the reason for error. This can be shown to a client user.

message.description: Text that provides more details and corrective actions related to the error. This can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URL pointing to documentation describing the error

@schemaLocation.description: Link to the schema describing this REST resource

Appointment.description: An Appointment is an arrangement to do something or meet someone at a particular time, at a place (for face to face appointment) or in a contact medium (for phone appointment).

href.description: Unique URI used to access to the appointment resource

externalId.description: External reference known by the customer

description.description: Short free text describing the appointment

category.description: Business category : intervention for example or to be more precise after SalesIntervention, orderDeliveryIntervention,...

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource. Here can be appointment

@type.description: Indicates the type of resource. Here can be appointment

@schemaLocation.description: Link to schema describing this REST resource

TimePeriod.description: Time period between a start date time and end date time

startDateTime.description: Start date time of the period

endDateTime.description: End date time of the period

id.description: Unique identifier of the attached document to the appointment

href.description: Reference of the attached document to the appointment

description.description: A short description of the attached document

mimeType.description: The mime type of the attached document

sizeUnit.description: Unit of measure used for the size

size.description: The size in Bytes of the document or attachment. If this component contains the embedded data then the size is the size of the embedded data; if it is a reference without the data then it is the size of the referenced document

url.description: The URL of the attached document

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of the attachment

@schemaLocation.description: Link to schema describing this REST resource

RelatedPartyRef.description: Related party reference. A related party defines a party linked to the appointment.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

role.description: Role played by the related party (customer, technician,… for example)

@referredType.description: Indicates the (class) type of the entity

Place.description: Describe a place for the appointment (using either geographicAddress or GeographicLocation) and/or identify an existing place (either an existing geographicAddress or existing GeographicLocation or existing GeographicSite) through its id

id.description: Unique identifier of a place - Must be a geographicAddress id or GeographicLocation id or GeographicSite id

name.description: Short text giving the complete place

role.description: Role of the place - could be an installation place for example

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST resource

RelatedEntityRef.description: Related entity reference. Related entity linked to the appointment

id.description: Unique identifier of the related entity

role.description: Role played by the related entity

@referredType.description: Indicates the (class) type of the entity

TimeSlot.description: Time slots for booking an appointment with a party

CalendarEventRef.description: Event in a calendar associated to the appointment

id.description: Unique identifier of the calendar event

description.description: A short text describing the calendar event for this appointment

@referredType.description: Indicates the (class) type of the calendar event

ContactMedium.description: Indicates the contact medium that could be used for the appointment

type.description: Type of the contact medium : phone number or email address

MediumCharacteristic.description: Describes the characteristics of the contact medium used for the appointment

phoneNumber.description: The primary phone number of the contact

emailAddress.description: Full email address in standard format

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of the medium characteristic

@schemaLocation.description: Link to the schema describing this REST resource

Hub.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

HubInput.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

SearchTimeSlot.description: This task resource is used to retrieve available time slots. One of this available time slot is after used to create or reschedule an appointment

id.description: Unique identifier of the search time slot request

href.description: Reference to access the search time slot resource

status.description: Status of the search time slot (rejected, inProgress, done or terminatedWithError)

searchDate.description: Date when the search time slot is performed

searchResult.description: Result of the search time slot (success or fail for example)

@schemaLocation.description: Link to schema describing this REST resource
